samples.context: Inertia in taking action to reduce the level of pollution stemmed largely from a widespread belief that the Ganga, as a holy river, had the ability to purify all that came into contact with it. Although there is some scientific evidence for the Ganga river’s high capacity to assimilate a large level of organic waste input, no river can sustain its self-purifying power with this kind of over-use.
samples.question: What belief hindered pollution action for the Ganga?

samples.context: The Ganga Action Plan (GAP) originated from the personal intervention and interest of our late Prime Minister Mrs Indira Gandhi who had directed the Central Board for the Prevention and Control of Water Pollution to do a comprehensive survey of the situation in 1979.
samples.question: Who initiated the Ganga Action Plan in 1979?
